author: Jenny Ling
title: Activists storm Kaitaia airport
text:
Last updated 15:25, September 8 2015 Ross Setford 
Ngati Kahu are protesting at Kaitaia airport over a Treat of Waitangi settlement. 
About 30 Maori activists are protesting at Kaitaia airport. 
Chief executive of Far North Holdings Andy Nock said the protesters are from Ngati Kahu. 
Far North Holdings manages the airport on behalf of the Far North District Council who lease the the building from the Crown. 
The protest related to a Treaty of Waitangi settlement, in its third reading tomorrow, Nock said. 
"They turned up and said they were holding a protest and that's it...we are ensuring their safety and making sure no-one goes airside," Nock said. 
"It relates to their disagreement with the settlement process. 
"It relates to something that's outside our management contract." 
The protesters were congregated in the carpark with placards. 
Airport manager Stan Hansen was on his way to Kaitaia police station to report the issue. 
Hansen said the protest started at around midday. 
Some Great Barrier airlines staff and other airport staff were blocked from accessing the site. 
"They [activists] blocked access to the building from the main road to the building. 
"They came down the road and came in and closed everything off. 
"They were erecting some kind of structure." - Stuff
